Description: Base sherd of Attic black-glaze pottery open vessel, possibly a plate; interior: glazed black; from exterior edge, stamped ovule band, stamped palmettes, two impressed circles at centre; body black, as far as preserved with reserved band at junction with black, slight, foot; underside, reserved with three black bands; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2012)
